its nice to see pros tryna switch it up but stop making articles about it. your are runeing the game for playes who already play agent the meta  play style.. players who  figure these things out way b4 the pros do it  that allows the game to evolve.. I feel all these articles do is take away from the creative players bag of tricks. I was paying my varus mud 2 month b4 the article came now  every one play it same with the vlad ....ive bin running trundle bot since s2....all u are doing is crapping on creativity.. if they didn't watch the and learn something u should not make an article about the surprise champ in line the then every one dose it and at also feel like u are steering  the meta itself. and its so sad cuz then come the trundle nerffes....
if the pros play it you aren't doing something crazy enough for it to be un-meta (non meta? not meta?)

pro players dont decide the meta, they just play what they feel is strong, however with riot making these articles its making information more accessible to low elo players about what pros do, which is a horrible idea, they dont understand that just because a pro play does it doesnt mean they can do it and it ruins solo queue

Pro players actually have a large part in deciding the meta. {{champion:6}} wasn't meta until he was played mid in the Lcs. He was strong before that game and after the patch giving him mana scaling on the shield, but he wasn't meta because everyone thought he was bad. Same with reworked Sion. He didn't have a buff between his rework and his Lcs debut, but people didn't start playing him that much until then.

 Nunu is strong in a tank meta because he has two sources of % hp with cinderhulk and his consume passive, and despite not having any hard cc his ult is so strong that people will often burn summoners to get out of it, it does massive aoe damage, and  it removes a ton of stats to anyone in the aoe,  but he isn't meta because the pros don't play him in Lcs.

 Nasus is strong in a tank meta because his wither makes the enemy marksman significantly less effective , he has a spell that can do large damage even when he builds full tank, and he has aoe armor shred, PLUS he has aoe % max hp damage, but he isn't meta because pros don't play him in the LCS.

 The thing is what is meta isn't always what is strong, it's what's popular, and lots of people will blindly follow what the pros do, making it meta. Things become popular because they're strong, but not everything that is strong in the current meta is considered meta.

any day before this LCS thingy, you would have gotten so much hate in any match trying to play trundle support. "Trundle's a top laner not a support dumbass" these people just... gawd. they are the reason I stay out of ranked.
I'm pretty sure most toplaners with crowd control can support. Not all of them can support well, but i'm sure the element of surprise can help occasionally.
I have done Maokai, Malphite, and Volibear. All of which work really well and are pretty strong for peeling, engaging, and roaming.
now we just need adc bard :O (2.5 attack speed is hilarious on him xD i highly recommend it)

Please, please, please... stop giving solo queue people bad ideas, like we don't have enough troll picks already. The most common thing I'm hearing nowadays is "I've seen that meta in LCS, so OP!", and then the guy finishes the game with an OP score of 0/7/2. Put a disclaimer like "This kind of plays are performed by professional gamers, don't try this at home!", thanks.
i played trundle support before all this lcs stuff, he is great for lane pushing and makes most adc life a living hell, i also have yet to loose a game as trundle support lo

People all over been doing this on and off for a long time. Really nothing new. I do agree though that when riot gives this kind of thing attention that a bunch of people whom don't have a clue how to play it, try it. Advise to all of you out there that are gonna try this...Do it in bots or custom games first so you at least have some idea of what you are doing before playing it in PvP. Cheers to all of you out there that already played Trundle Support before the hype and play it well. You know who you are.

... i usually get offended when a pro player gets credit for something that the masses do waaay before... but your comment ceased my rage... i thank you sir/ma'am(its usually the support idea like the naut support thing) i cant wait for the article on skarner support XD
